alert.note: Alert for Fisher; Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 1:52PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Nolan and eastern Fisher Counties through 245 PM CST... At 152 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Roscoe, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sweetwater, Roscoe, Roby, Maryneal, Sylvester, Mccaulley, Longworth, Champion, I-20 Near The Nolan-Mitchell County Line, Hitson, Gannon, Lake Sweetwater, Busby, Capitola, The Intersection Of Highway 70 And Ranch Road 53, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 608 And Highway 147 and Camp Boothe Oaks. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 229 and 259. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for west central Texas.
